description: Create a DataModel, attach a dataset (connection/database/schema), and add one or more tables in a single operation. Use datamodel_type='extract' (Elasticube/EC) or 'live'. For 'extract', optional per-table build_behavior_config controls replace/append/increment behavior.

datamodel_name.description: Target DataModel name to create or update.

datamodel_type.description: DataModel type. Use 'extract' for Elasticube (aka EC) or 'live' for Live models. Aliases like 'ec'/'elasticube' must be normalized to 'extract'.

connection_name.description: Existing Sisense connection name to bind for the dataset.

dataset_name.description: Optional dataset name. Defaults to schema_name when omitted.

tables.description: List of tables to add. For 'live' models, build_behavior_config is ignored. For 'extract' models, set build_behavior_config as needed.

database_name.description: Optional override of the table's database. Defaults to top-level database_name if omitted.

schema_name.description: Optional override of the table's schema. Defaults to top-level schema_name if omitted.

table_name.description: Physical table name to add, or a logical name when using import_query.

import_query.description: Optional custom SQL to import rows (e.g., SELECT ... LIMIT 10). If provided, supersedes physical table fetch.

tags.description: Optional list of tags for the table.

build_behavior_config.description: Only used for 'extract' models. Ignored for 'live'. For 'increment' mode, column_name is required.

mode.description: Table build behavior for extract models.

examples.user_query: Set up an EC (elasticube) DataModel 'fda_food_ec' on BigQuery fda_food with food_enforcement and enforcement tables.
examples.notes: Alias 'EC/elasticube' is normalized to datamodel_type='extract'. Simple table adds without custom queries.

examples.user_query: Create a Live DataModel 'nyctaxi_live' from Databricks samples.nyctaxi with trips and vendors; dataset name can default.
examples.notes: dataset_name omitted so it defaults to schema_name. build_behavior_config ignored for live.

examples.user_query: Set up an extract DataModel 'nyctaxi_ec' with a custom import query and incremental build on trips.
examples.notes: Shows custom SQL and per-table build behavior for extract models; 'increment' requires column_name.

description: Migrates all dashboards from the source to the target environment in batches.

action.description: Strategy to handle existing dashboards in the target environment.

republish.description: Whether to republish dashboards after migration.

migrate_share.description: Whether to migrate shares for the dashboards.

change_ownership.description: Whether to change ownership of dashboards (usually requires migrating shares).

batch_size.description: Number of dashboards to process per batch.

examples.user_query: Migrate all dashboards from the dev environment to the prod environment in batches of 20, waiting 5 seconds between batches, and republish them
examples.notes: Use this call when you want to migrate all dashboards from one environment to another, with minimal downtime and automatic republishing.

examples.user_query: Migrate all dashboards in batches of 50, overwriting any existing dashboards in the target environment, and changing ownership
examples.notes: Use this call when you want to migrate all dashboards and overwrite any existing ones in the target environment, with a larger batch size for faster migration.

examples.user_query: Migrate all dashboards from the staging environment to the prod environment in batches of 10, waiting 2 seconds between batches, without republishing or changing ownership
examples.notes: Use this call when you want to migrate all dashboards with minimal impact on the target environment and no automatic republishing.

description: Migrates all data models from the source environment to the target environment in batches.

dependencies.description: Dependencies to include for each data model. If omitted, all dependencies are included by default.

shares.description: Whether to also migrate data model shares.

batch_size.description: Number of data models to process per batch.

action.description: Strategy to handle existing data models in the target environment.

examples.user_query: Migrate all data models from the source environment to the target environment in batches of 5, waiting 5 seconds between batches, and overwriting any existing models
examples.notes: Use this call when you want to migrate all data models and all of their dependencies and shares, overwriting any existing models in the target environment.

examples.user_query: Migrate all data models with their shares and formulas from the source environment to the target environment in batches of 10, waiting 10 seconds between batches
examples.notes: Use this call when you want to migrate all data models with their formulas and shares, creating duplicate models in the target environment.

examples.user_query: Migrate all data models from the source environment to the target environment in batches of 20, waiting 15 seconds between batches, and migrating data security dependencies
examples.notes: Use this call when you want to migrate all data models with only their data security dependencies, overwriting any existing models in the target environment.

description: Migrates all groups from the source environment to the target environment using the bulk endpoint.

examples.user_query: Migrate all groups from the source environment to the target environment
examples.notes: Use this call when you want to migrate all groups from one environment to another without specifying particular groups.

examples.user_query: Replicate all user groups from dev to prod
examples.notes: Useful for synchronizing groups between environments, such as from development to production.

examples.user_query: Initialize the target environment with all groups from the source
examples.notes: Use this call to set up a new target environment by migrating all groups from an existing source environment.

description: Migrates all users from the source environment to the target environment using the bulk endpoint.

examples.user_query: Migrate all users from the source environment to the target environment
examples.notes: Use this call when you want to migrate all users from one environment to another without specifying particular users.

examples.user_query: Replicate the user base from our development environment to our production environment
examples.notes: Useful for ensuring that all users in a development environment are also present in the production environment.

examples.user_query: Sync all users from the source to the target system
examples.notes: Use this call for synchronizing the user base between two Sisense environments, such as from staging to live.

description: Migrates shares for specific dashboards from the source to the target environment.

source_dashboard_ids.description: List of source dashboard IDs whose shares should be migrated.

target_dashboard_ids.description: List of target dashboard IDs that correspond to the source dashboards.

change_ownership.description: Whether to change ownership of the dashboards on the target environment.

examples.user_query: Migrate shares for dashboards with IDs 123 and 456 from dev to prod
examples.notes: Use when migrating dashboard shares between environments and mapping source dashboards to different target dashboard IDs.

examples.user_query: Transfer ownership of dashboard shares for IDs 111 and 222
examples.notes: Use when changing ownership of existing dashboards while keeping the same IDs in source and target.

examples.user_query: Migrate shares for dashboards with IDs 333 and 444 without changing ownership
examples.notes: Use when migrating dashboard shares but retaining the existing owners in the target environment.

description: Migrates specific dashboards from the source to the target environment using the bulk endpoint.

dashboard_ids.description: List of dashboard IDs to migrate.

dashboard_names.description: List of dashboard titles to migrate.

action.description: Strategy to handle existing dashboards in the target environment.

republish.description: Whether to republish dashboards after migration.

change_ownership.description: Whether to change ownership of dashboards (usually requires migrating shares).

examples.user_query: Migrate the 'Sales' and 'Marketing' dashboards from the source environment to the target environment, overwriting any existing dashboards with the same name
examples.notes: Use this call when you need to migrate specific dashboards and update their shares and ownership in the target environment.

examples.user_query: Migrate the dashboards with IDs '12345' and '67890' from the source environment to the target environment, skipping any existing dashboards with the same ID
examples.notes: Use this call when you need to migrate specific dashboards without overwriting existing ones in the target environment.

examples.user_query: Migrate the 'Executive Summary' dashboard from the source environment to the target environment, duplicating it if it already exists, and migrate its shares
examples.notes: Use this call when you need to migrate a dashboard and create a duplicate if it already exists in the target environment, while also migrating its shares.

description: Migrates specific data models from the source environment to the target environment.

datamodel_ids.description: List of data model IDs to migrate.

datamodel_names.description: List of data model titles to migrate.

provider_connection_map.description: Mapping of provider name to connection ID for the target environment. Keys are provider names, values are connection IDs.

dependencies.description: Dependencies to include for each data model. If omitted, all dependencies are included by default.

shares.description: Whether to also migrate the data model's shares.

action.description: Strategy to handle existing data models in the target environment.

new_title.description: New name for the duplicated data model (used only when action='duplicate').

examples.user_query: Migrate the 'Sales' and 'Marketing' data models from the source environment to the target environment, including their dependencies and shares
examples.notes: Use this call to migrate specific data models along with all of their dependencies and shares.

examples.user_query: Migrate the data model with ID 'dddfac9f-86e6-4a9a-af28-f52106dcc55c' from the source environment to the target environment, overwriting any existing model with the same ID, including data security and formulas
examples.notes: Use this call to migrate a specific data model and overwrite any existing model in the target environment.

examples.user_query: Migrate the 'Customer' data model from the source environment to the target environment, duplicating it with a new name 'Customer Copy' and including its formulas and perspectives dependencies
examples.notes: Use this call to migrate a data model and create a duplicate in the target environment with a new name and selected dependencies.

description: Migrates specific groups from the source environment to the target environment using the bulk endpoint.

group_name_list.description: List of group names to migrate.

examples.user_query: Migrate the groups 'Admins' and 'Developers' from the source environment to the target environment
examples.notes: Use this call to migrate specific groups, useful when setting up a new environment or syncing groups between environments.

examples.user_query: Migrate the group 'Customers' from the source environment to the target environment
examples.notes: Use this call to migrate a single group, for example when a new group is created in the source environment and needs to be synced with the target environment.

examples.user_query: Migrate multiple groups 'Sales', 'Marketing', and 'IT' from the source environment to the target environment
examples.notes: Use this call to migrate multiple groups at once, useful when setting up a new environment or syncing multiple groups between environments.

description: Migrates specific users from the source environment to the target environment.

user_name_list.description: List of user email addresses to migrate.

examples.user_query: Migrate the users john.doe and jane.smith from the source environment to the target environment
examples.notes: Use this call to migrate specific users from one environment to another.

examples.user_query: Migrate all users in the IT department from the source environment to the target environment
examples.notes: Use this call to migrate a list of users from one environment to another, for example when onboarding a new team.

examples.user_query: Migrate the user admin from the source environment to the target environment
examples.notes: Use this call to migrate a single user, such as an administrator, from one environment to another.
